intro: Coccoceras sumatranum, commonly known as the Sumatran sea grape, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a fleshy, succulent stem that bears small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in coastal environments, often found in shallow, brackish waters along the shores of Southeast Asia. Its reproductive structures are adapted to water dispersal, allowing for the spread of its seeds through marine currents. Coccoceras sumatranum plays a role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
